citeinfo.title: Metabolism estimates for 356 U.S. rivers (2007-2017): 3. Timeseries data
citeinfo.geoform: Tab-separated values, one file per variable, up to 25 files per site, for 753 sites. Files for each site are packaged and compressed in .zip format.

descript.abstract:
This dataset provides timeseries data on water quality and quantity, as collected or computed from outside sources. The format is many tables with one row per time series observation (1 tab-delimited file per site-variable combination, 1 zip file per site).
This compilation of data is intended for use in estimating or interpreting metabolism. Sites were included if they met the initial criteria of having at least 100 dissolved oxygen observations and one of the accepted NWIS site types ('ST','ST-CA','ST-DCH','ST-TS', or 'SP').
This dataset is part of a larger data release of metabolism model inputs and outputs for 356 streams and rivers across the United States (https://doi.org/10.5066/F70864KX). The complete release includes: modeled estimates of gross primary productivity, ecosystem respiration, and the gas exchange coefficient; model input data and alternative input data; model fit and diagnostic information; site catchment boundaries and site point locations; and potential predictors of metabolism such as discharge and light availability.
descript.purpose: A continental-scale quantification of energy flow in streams and rivers can facilitate better understanding of links between aquatic energy cycling and ecosystem services, the seasonality and dynamism of stream energy flow, and the effects of human activities on aquatic activity. This data release provides multi-day time series estimates of energy flow as metabolism (gross primary productivity and ecosystem respiration) for 356 streams and rivers across the United States.

spdom.descgeog: Stream and river monitoring sites in the U.S. Geological Survey's observation network

place.placekt: Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4, Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D. C., NIST

idinfo.useconst: None, but see Distribution Liability below. Users are advised to read the associated publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: This work was funded by the USGS Powell Center (Working Group title: "Continental-scale overview of stream primary productivity, its links to water quality, and consequences for aquatic carbon biogeochemistry"). Additional financial support came from the USGS NAWQA program and Office of Water Information. NSF grants DEB-1146283 and EF1442501 partially supported ROH. The USGS T.C. Chamberlin Modeling Center provided access to the HTCondor cluster for generating metabolism estimates.
idinfo.native: This dataset was generated using open source tools available in the R programming language (R version 3.4.3 (2017-11-30)). Mac (x86_64-apple-darwin15.6.0) and Windows (x86_64-w64-mingw32) computers were used to generate the data and metadata. R packages used: streamMetabolizer version 0.10.1; mda.streams version 0.10.4; sbtools version 1.1.6; dplyr version 0.7.4; magrittr version 1.5; meddle version 0.0.4; sbtools version 1.1.6; whisker version 0.3-2; yaml version 2.1.17.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

citeinfo.title: National Water Information System data available on the World Wide Web (USGS Water Data for the Nation)

srcinfo.srccontr: This source, accessed January 2017, provided subhourly to hourly data on dissolved oxygen concentrations, water temperature, and discharge for all sites included in this metabolism data release.

citeinfo.title: NLDAS Primary Forcing Data L4 Hourly 0.125 x 0.125 degree V002

srcinfo.srccontr: This source, accessed January 2017, provided hourly data on surface air pressure and downward shortwave radiation flux for sites located anywhere within the continental U.S. (latitude/longitude bounding box of -125.0, 25.0, -67.0, 53.0).

citeinfo.title: GLDAS Noah Land Surface Model L4 3 hourly 0.25 x 0.25 degree V2.0

srcinfo.srccontr: This source, accessed January 2017, provided 3-hourly data on surface air pressure and downward shortwave radiation flux for sites located anywhere globally.

citeinfo.title: Scaling the gas transfer velocity and hydraulic geometry in streams and small rivers. Limnology & Oceanography: Fluids & Environments 2 (2012): 41-53.

srcinfo.srccontr: This source provided hydraulic geometry coefficients used in the computation of the stream depth estimates with Entity Type Label nwis_XXXX-ts_depth_calcDischRaymond.tsv.

citeinfo.title: Oxygen solubility in seawater: Better fitting equations. Limnology and Oceanography, 37(6).

srcinfo.srccontr: This source provided the equation and coefficients for estimating oxygen saturation concentrations (Entity Type Labels nwis_XXXX-ts_dosat_calcGGbconst.tsv and nwis_XXXX-ts_dosat_calcGGbts.tsv).

citeinfo.title: streamMetabolizer: Models for Estimating Aquatic Photosynthesis and Respiration, version 0.10.1
citeinfo.geoform: Software package for the R statistical programming language

srcinfo.srccontr: This software source provided the metabolism model implementation used to generate metabolism estimates for this project. See https://dx.doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.838795 for an archived copy of the source code exactly as used for this project. See https://owi.usgs.gov/R/gran.html for instructions on how to access current versions of the software from the U.S. Geological Survey archive.

procstep.procdesc: Raw timeseries data were downloaded from two data sources: Data on dissolved oxygen concentrations, water temperature, and discharge were downloaded from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System database (NWIS; see Source Citation for USGS_NWIS). Data on shortwave radiation and air pressure were downloaded from the North American Land Data Assimilation System (NLDAS; see Source Citation for NLDAS_FORA0125_H.002) and the Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS; see Source Citation for GLDAS_NOAH025_3H_V2.0). Additional variables were calculated from these raw sources using data-preparation functions from the streamMetabolizer R package (see Source Citations for Appling et al. 2017, Garcia and Gordon 1992, and Raymond et al. 2012).

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named baro_gldas; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Surface air pressure. Downloaded parameter psurf_f_inst from GLDAS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named baro_nldas; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Surface pressure. Downloaded parameter pressfc from NLDAS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named doamp_calcDAmp; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Daily amplitude in dissolved oxygen percent saturation. Daily (4am to 3:59am) mean of from dopsat_calcObsSat

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named doobs_nwis; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Dissolved oxygen concentration. Downloaded parameter 00300 from NWIS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named dopsat_calcObsSat; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Percent dissolved oxygen saturation. Calculated as 100*doobs_nwis/dosat_calcGGbts

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named dosat_calcGGbts; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary

Hypothetical dissolved oxygen concentration at saturation. Calculated from baro_nldas (or baro_gldas when baro_nldas unavailable) with streamMetabolizer calc_DO_sat function, using coefficients from Garcia and Gordon 1992

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named par_calcLat; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Photosynthetically active radiation. Calculated from site latitude and suntime_calcLon with streamMetabolizer calc_light function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named par_calcLatSw; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Photosynthetically active radiation. Merger of par_calcLat and par_calcSw using streamMetabolizer calc_light_merged function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named par_calcSw; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Photosynthetically active radiation. Calculated from sw_nldas (or sw_gldas when sw_nldas unavailable) with streamMetabolizer convert_SW_to_PAR function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named sitedate_calcLon; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Date expressed as solar noon at the site. Calculated with streamMetabolizer convert_UTC_to_solartime function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named sitetime_calcLon; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Mean solar time. Calculated from DateTime and site longitude with streamMetabolizer convert_UTC_to_solartime function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named suntime_calcLon; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Apparent solar time. Calculated from DateTime and site coordinates with streamMetabolizer convert_UTC_to_solartime function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named sw_gldas; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Downward shortwave radiation flux, surface. Downloaded parameter SWdown_f_tavg from GLDAS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named sw_nldas; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Downwards shortwave radiation flux, surface. Downloaded parameter dswrfsfc from NLDAS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named swdaily_calcDMean; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Daily average downwards shortwave radiation flux. Daily (4am to 3:59am) mean of sw_nldas (or sw_gldas when sw_nldas unavailable)

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named wtr_nwis; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Water temperature. Downloaded parameter 00010 from NWIS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named baro_calcElev; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Surface pressure. Calculated from site elevation using streamMetabolizer calc_air_pressure function

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named dosat_calcGGbconst; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Hypothetical dissolved oxygen concentration at saturation. Calculated from baro_calcElev with streamMetabolizer calc_DO_sat function, using coefficients from Garcia and Gordon 1992

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named depth_calcDischHarvey; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Spatially averaged stream depth (m). Calculated from discharge (Q, m^3 s^-1) and the site-specific hydraulic geometry coefficients c and f, where depth=cQ^f

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named depth_calcDischRaymond; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Spatially averaged stream depth (m). Calculated from discharge (Q, m^3 s^-1) and global hydraulic geometry coefficients c and f from Raymond et al. 2012, where depth=cQ^f

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named disch_nwis; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Discharge. Downloaded parameter 00060 from NWIS database

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named dischdaily_calcDMean; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Daily average discharge. Daily (4am to 3:59am) mean of disch_nwis

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named veloc_calcDischHarvey; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Stream velocity (m s^-1). Calculated from discharge (Q, m^3 s^-1) and the site-specific hydraulic geometry coefficients k and m in site_data.tsv, where velocity=kQ^m

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named veloc_calcDischRaymond; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Stream velocity (m s^-1). Calculated from discharge (Q, m^3 s^-1) and global hydraulic geometry coefficients k and m from Raymond et al. 2012, where velocity=kQ^m

enttyp.enttypd: Tab-separated 2-column data table containing date-time stamps (first column) and values for the variable code-named velocdaily_calcDMean; see attribute definition for 2nd column for variable and data source details.

attr.attrdef: Date-time in UTC. Acquired from contributing dataset[s] and converted to UTC if necessary
Daily average velocity. Daily (4am to 3:59am) mean of veloc_calcDischHarvey (or veloc_calcDischRaymond when veloc_calcDischHarvey unavailable)

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: This information is preliminary or provisional and is subject to revision. It is being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The information has not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and is provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the information.

digtinfo.formname: Tab-separated values, one file per variable, up to 25 files per site, for 753 sites. Files for each site are packaged and compressed in .zip format.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
